00017 template <class T, class Metric>
00018 class CoverTree {
00019 protected:
00021   struct Node {
00024     typedef std::pair<int, Node> Child;
00025 
00027     typedef std::vector<Child> ChildContainer;
00028 
00030     struct Compare: public std::binary_function<Child, Child, bool> {
00031       bool operator()(const Child &a, const Child &b) const {
00032         return a.first > b.first;
00033       }
00034     };
00035     
00038     Node(const T &x): x(x) {}
00039 
00040     T x;
00041     ChildContainer children;
00042   };
00043   
00047   struct LinkData {
00052     struct Compare: public std::binary_function<LinkData,LinkData,bool> {
00053       bool operator()(const LinkData &a, const LinkData &b) const {
00054         return a.level() < b.level();
00055       }
00056     };
00057     
00063     LinkData(Node *node, double d):
00064       it(node->children.begin()), end(node->children.end()), d(d) {}
00065     
00068     int level() const {
00069       return it->first;
00070     }
00071 
00075     bool relevant(double margin = 0) const {
00076       return it != end && d < margin + std::ldexp(1., level() + 1);
00077     }
00078 
00079     typename Node::ChildContainer::iterator it;
00080     typename Node::ChildContainer::iterator end;
00081     double d;
00082   };
00083 
00084 public:
00087   CoverTree(bool duplicate = false):
00088     root(NULL), duplicate(duplicate)
00089   {}
00090 
00094   CoverTree(const Metric &d, bool duplicate = false):
00095     root(NULL), d(d), duplicate(duplicate)
00096   {}

00099   CoverTree(const CoverTree &other):
00100     root(new Node(*other.root)),
00101     d(other.d),
00102     duplicate(other.duplicate)
00103   {}

00105   ~CoverTree() {
00106     delete root;
00107   }

00110   CoverTree &operator=(const CoverTree &other) {
00111     delete root;
00112     root = new Node(other->root);
00113     d = other.d;
00114     duplicate = other.duplicate;

00122   const T &insert(const T &x) {
00123     return insert_node(x)->x;
00124   }
00125 
00129   bool remove(const T &x) {
00130     if (root == NULL)
00131       return false;
00132     if (root->x == x) {
00133       Node *old = root;
00134       root = NULL;
00135       move_children(*old); // Reinsert all descendents into tree.
00136       delete old;
00137       return true;
00138     }
00139     return remove_recursive(x, *root);
00140   }
00141   
00150   template <class OutputIterator>
00151   OutputIterator nearest(OutputIterator out, const T &x, unsigned k) {
00152     if (root != NULL) {
00153       // The k nearest instances found so far, initialized to the
00154       // root, along with their distances from x.
00155       std::vector<std::pair<double, Node *> > nearest;
00156       nearest.reserve(k);
00157       nearest.push_back(std::make_pair(d(x, root->x), root));
00158 
00159       // A priority queue of iterators through all the nodes relevant
00160       // to this search, initialized to the first child of the root.
00161       std::vector<LinkData> pqueue;
00162       LinkData front = LinkData(nearest.front().second, nearest.front().first);
00163       pqueue.push_back(front);
00164       typename LinkData::Compare cmp;
00165 
00166       // Traverse the cover tree by order of level, pruning branches
00167       // that are too far from x to be a nearest neighbor.
00168       while (!pqueue.empty()) {
00169         const int level = pqueue.front().level();
00170 
00171         // If a node is farther away from x than this threshold, then
00172         // none of its children can be one of the k nearest neighbors.
00173         const double threshold =
00174           nearest.back().first + std::ldexp(1., level + 1);
00175 
00176         // Search one entire level at a time.
00177         while (!pqueue.empty() && pqueue.front().level() == level) {
00178           front = pqueue.front();
00179           std::pop_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00180           pqueue.pop_back();
00181 
00182           // Look at all of this LinkData's children that joined the
00183           // tree at this level.
00184           while (front.it != front.end && front.level() == level) {
00185             if (front.d < threshold) {
00186               // The current child may be a nearest neighbor or an
00187               // ancestor of one.
00188               Node *node = &front.it->second;
00189               const double dist = d(x, node->x);
00190 
00191               // If this node is nearer than the last node in nearest (or
00192               // if nearest is not yet at k instances), then add it to
00193               // our results.
00194               if (dist < nearest.back().first || nearest.size() < k) {
00195                 while (nearest.size() >= k)
00196                   nearest.pop_back();
00197                 std::pair<double, Node *> val = std::make_pair(dist,node);
00198                 nearest.insert(std::lower_bound(nearest.begin(),
00199                                                 nearest.end(),
00200                                                 val),
00201                                val);
00202               }
00203 
00204               // Try adding the children of this node to the queue.
00205               LinkData child = LinkData(node, dist);
00206               if (child.relevant(nearest.back().first)) {
00207                 pqueue.push_back(child);
00208                 std::push_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00209               }
00210             }
00211             ++front.it;
00212           }
00213 
00214           // The level of the next child in this LinkData has
00215           // decreased.  See if it's still relevant to our search.
00216           if (front.relevant(nearest.back().first)) {
00217             pqueue.push_back(front);
00218             std::push_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00219           }
00220         }
00221       }
00222       
00223       // Output the results.
00224       typename std::vector<std::pair<double, Node *> >::const_iterator it;
00225       for (it = nearest.begin(); it != nearest.end(); ++it)
00226         *out++ = std::make_pair(it->first, it->second->x);
00227     }
00228     return out;
00229   }

00240   template <class OutputIterator>
00241   OutputIterator neighbors(OutputIterator out,
00242                            const T &x,
00243                            double margin) const
00244   {
00245     if (root != NULL)
00246       out = recursive_neighbors(out, x, margin, *root);
00247     return out;
00248   }
00249 
00253   template <class OutputIterator>
00254   OutputIterator contents(OutputIterator out) const {
00255     return recursive_contents(out, *root);
00256   }
00257 
00265   void print(std::ostream &out) const {
00266     if (root != NULL) {
00267       print(out, root);
00268     }
00269   }

00272   void clear() {
00273     delete root;
00274     root = NULL;
00275   }

00277 protected:
00280   Node *insert_node(const T &x) {
00281     Node *retval;
00282     if (root == NULL) {
00283       root = new Node(x);
00284       retval = root;
00285     } else {
00286       // Keep track of closest valid parent instance for x, as well as
00287       // its distance from x.
00288       double min = d(x, root->x);
00289       Node *parent = root;
00290 
00291       // Search the tree by iterating through each node's children, in
00292       // order of level, while each child list contains instances that
00293       // may be the closest node (and are therefore relevant).
00294       std::vector<LinkData> pqueue; // x.relevant() for all x in pqueue
00295       const LinkData rootdata(parent, min);
00296       int level;
00297       if (rootdata.relevant()) {
00298         level = rootdata.level();
00299         pqueue.push_back(rootdata);
00300       }
00301       typename LinkData::Compare cmp;
00302       
00303       // Look for the first level such that x is very far from every
00304       // point at that level, while also tracking the closest covering
00305       // point
00306       while (!pqueue.empty() && min < std::ldexp(1., level + 1) && min > 0) {
00307         level = pqueue.front().level();
00308         // Search one full level at atime.
00309         while (!pqueue.empty() && pqueue.front().level() == level) {
00310           LinkData current = pqueue.front();
00311           std::pop_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00312           pqueue.pop_back();
00313           // Check all children in this LinkData that join the tree at
00314           // this level.
00315           while (current.it != current.end && current.level() == level) {
00316             Node *node = &current.it->second;
00317             const double dist = d(x, node->x);
00318             if (min > dist && dist < std::ldexp(1., level - 1)) {
00319               // This node is now the closest valid parent so far.
00320               min = dist;
00321               parent = node;
00322             }
00323 
00324             // Add this node's children to the queue, if relevant.
00325             LinkData child(node, dist);
00326             if (child.relevant()) {
00327               pqueue.push_back(child);
00328               std::push_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00329             }
00330             ++current.it;
00331           }
00332 
00333           // Add the remaining children of this LinkData back to the
00334           // queue, if relevant.
00335           if (current.relevant()) {
00336             pqueue.push_back(current);
00337             std::push_heap(pqueue.begin(), pqueue.end(), cmp);
00338           }
00339         }
00340       }
00341 
00342       if (min > 0 || duplicate) {
00343         // Insert x if it has positive distance from all existing
00344         // instances or if we allow duplicates.
00345         if (min > 0)
00346           std::frexp(min, &level); // Level at which x joins the tree
00347         else
00348           level = std::numeric_limits<int>::min(); // For duplicates
00349         typename Node::Child val(level, Node(x));
00350         typename Node::ChildContainer::iterator pos =
00351           std::lower_bound(parent->children.begin(), parent->children.end(),
00352                            val, typename Node::Compare());
00353         pos = parent->children.insert(pos, val);
00354         retval = &pos->second;
00355       } else
00356         retval = parent;
00357     }
00358     return retval;
00359   }
00360 
00362   void move_children(Node &parent) {
00363     typename Node::ChildContainer::iterator it = parent.children.begin();
00364     while (it != parent.children.end()) {
00365       Node &child = it->second;
00366       insert_node(child.x);
00367       move_children(child);
00368       ++it;
00369     }
00370   }
00371 
00376   bool remove_recursive(const T &x, Node &node) {
00377     const double dist = d(x, node.x);
00378     typename Node::ChildContainer::iterator it = node.children.begin();
00379 
00380     if (dist == 0) {
00381       // We assume node.x != x, so x must be a direct child of this node.
00382       while (it != node.children.end()) {
00383         if (it->second.x == x) {
00384           node.children.erase(it);
00385           return true;
00386         }
00387         ++it;
00388       }
00389       return false;
00390     }
00391 
00392     // Check the children of this node, and recurse if the children are
00393     // close enough to contain x.
00394     while (it != node.children.end() && dist < std::ldexp(1, 1 + it->first)) {
00395       Node &child = it->second;
00396       if (x == child.x) {
00397         Node copy(x); // x is just a convenient value, we won't be keeping this
00398         copy.children.swap(child.children);
00399         node.children.erase(it); // child ref now invalid!
00400         move_children(copy);
00401         return true;
00402       }
00403       if (remove_recursive(x, child))
00404         return true;
00405       ++it;
00406     }
00407     return false;
00408   }
00409 
00410   template <class OutputIterator>
00411   OutputIterator recursive_neighbors(OutputIterator out,
00412                                      const T &x,
00413                                      double margin,
00414                                      const Node &node) const
00415   {
00416     const double dist = d(x, node.x);
00417     if (dist < margin)
00418       *out++ = std::make_pair(dist, node.x);
00419     typename Node::ChildContainer::const_iterator it = node.children.begin();
00420     while (it != node.children.end()
00421            && dist < margin + std::ldexp(1., 1 + it->first)) {
00422       out = recursive_neighbors(out, x, margin, it->second);
00423       ++it;
00424     }
00425     return out;
00426   }
00427 
00428   template <class OutputIterator>
00429   OutputIterator recursive_contents(OutputIterator out, const Node &node) const{
00430     *out++ = node.x;
00431     typename Node::ChildContainer::const_iterator it = node.children.begin();
00432     while (it != node.children.end()) {
00433       out = recursive_contents(out, it->second);
00434       ++it;
00435     }
00436     return out;
00437   }
00438 
00439   static void print(std::ostream &out, const Node *node) {
00440     typename Node::ChildContainer::const_iterator it = node->children.begin();
00441     while (it != node->children.end()) {
00442       out << it->first << "\t"
00443           << node->x << "\t"
00444           << it->second.x << "\n";
00445       print(out, it->second);
00446       ++it;
00447     }
00448   }

00452   Metric d;
00453   bool duplicate;
00454 };
